intro: Bouvardia villosa, commonly known as the velvet flower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, delicate, pink or white flowers. The plant has waxy, velvety leaves that give it its common name, and it is often cultivated as a decorative plant. Bouvardia villosa prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it suitable for indoor gardening. Its long-lasting blooms make it a popular choice for floral arrangements.
